parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3 </value></part><part><name>Game</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.92</value></part><part><name>Game Version </name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value>  </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments </name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value>  </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects </name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>serverExec</name>=<value>  </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Execution ("server" or empty)</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Math </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Math - Vectors </value></part><part><name>GROUP2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns resulting matrix from the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matrix_multiplication multiplication] of two matrices. First matrix must be of the size n ✕ '''k''', while the second must be of the size '''k''' ✕ m, i.e <tt>columns</tt> matrix1 <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>==</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> <tt>rows</tt> matrix2. The resulting matrix will be of the size n ✕ m. If the shapes do not match, empty array [] will be returned.<br><br>
[[Image:matrixMultiply.jpg|600px]]</value></part><part><name>Description</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> matrix1 [[matrixMultiply]] matrix2 </value></part><part><name>Syntax</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value>matrix1: [[Array]] - matrix of the size <tt>n</tt>''(rows)'' ✕ <tt>k</tt>''(columns)''

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value>matrix2: [[Array]] - matrix of the size <tt>k</tt>''(rows)'' ✕ <tt>m</tt>''(columns)''

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - resulting matrix of the size <tt>n</tt>''(rows)'' ✕ <tt>m</tt>''(columns)''</value></part><part><name>Return Value</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[
	[2],
	[2]
] 
[[matrixMultiply]] 
[ 
	[3] 
]
/* returns 
[
	[6],
	[6]
] */</code> </value></part><part><name>Example 1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[
	[-1,0,0],
	[0,-1,0]
] 
[[matrixMultiply]] 
[
	[1,2],
	[3,1],
	[2,3]
] 
/* returns 
[
	[-1,-2],
	[-3,-1]
] */</code> </value></part><part><name>Example 2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value>  [[matrixTranspose]], [[vectorAdd]], [[vectorMagnitude]], [[vectorNormalized]], [[vectorMultiply]], [[vectorDotProduct]], [[vectorCrossProduct]], [[vectorDistance]], [[vectorLinearConversion]], [[vectorCos]], [[vectorFromTo]], [[vectorModelToWorld]], [[vectorWorldToModel]], [[BIS_fnc_transformVectorDirAndUp]] </value></part><part><name>See Also</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- BEGIN Note Section -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on 30 Jun, 2019
<dt class="note">[[User:oOKexOo| oOKexOo]]<dd class="note">
Note that this command won't transform a 1D array automatically into a column vector
<code>
[[-1,0,0],[0,-1,0],[0,0,-1]] [[matrixMultiply]] [1,2,3] // wrong, syntax error
[[-1,0,0],[0,-1,0],[0,0,-1]] [[matrixMultiply]] &#91;[1,2,3]] // wrong, will return []
[[-1,0,0],[0,-1,0],[0,0,-1]] [[matrixMultiply]] [[1], [2], [3]] // correct, will return [[-1], [-2], [-3]]
</code>
<comment><!-- END Note Section -->
</comment></dl>
